parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To know, know of, understand. Apparently a middle voice of ephistemi; to put the mind upon, i.e. Comprehend, or be acquainted with.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Illegal, unlawful, criminal, lawless. By implication, flagitious.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From kolla; to glue, i.e. to stick.
Foreign, of another tribe or race. From allos and phule; foreign, i.e. Gentile.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an obsolete primary of the same meaning; to show.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Probably from sun; common, i.e. shared by all or several, or profane.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
